details: Create project scaffolding with TypeScript strict mode and Jest test runner. This is the foundation for all subsequent features.
steps: Create tsconfig.json with strict mode enabled
Setup package.json with dev dependencies (TypeScript, Jest)
Create src/ folder structure: types/, components/, lib/, service/, app/
Setup Jest configuration (jest.config.js)
Create a simple test example: src/__tests__/setup.test.ts
Verify: pnpm install && pnpm typecheck && pnpm test both pass

description: Define User data model and TypeScript types
details: Create foundational data schema that authentication and dashboard features will depend on. Includes types and validation.
steps: Create src/types/user.ts with User interface: { id, email, name, createdAt }
Create src/service/user.service.ts with mock user data
Write unit test src/__tests__/user.test.ts: verify User type compiles and validates
Ensure: pnpm typecheck passes (no type errors in User types)
Ensure: pnpm test passes (includes arch-001 tests + new user tests)

details: Build login page and auth API using User data model from data-001. Session persists with mock login.
steps: Create src/app/login.tsx (login page with email input)
Create src/app/api/auth/login.ts endpoint (returns User object from service)
Setup session middleware to protect routes
Write integration test src/__tests__/auth.test.ts: login creates session, User type validates
Ensure: pnpm typecheck passes (no type errors using User types)
Ensure: pnpm test passes (arch-001 + data-001 + auth tests all pass)

details: Create dashboard page that displays authenticated user's profile. Uses User type from data-001 and auth from auth-001.
steps: Create src/app/dashboard.tsx (protected route, displays User profile)
Fetch logged-in user from session and display email, name, createdAt
Write end-to-end test src/__tests__/dashboard.test.ts: login â†’ dashboard shows correct user
Ensure: pnpm typecheck passes (no type errors)
Ensure: pnpm test passes (all 4 features' tests pass: arch + data + auth + dashboard)
